botSettings.name: Milly
botSettings.description: I am the default bot! You may write whatever you wish in here.

Okay! Sorry, did I bother you?
Would you like to join me?
And that is the end of the tour.
Would you like to stop the tour?
Okay! I'm at the next stop. Come join me!
Okay! Come talk to me if you change your mind!
Tell me when you would like to proceed.
This is the end of the tour. Anything else you would like to know?
...We weren't on a tour, were we?
I tripped a flood detect. I'm sorry, I didn't mean to!
...We weren't on a tour, were we?
Sorry, you're not on the access list. I'm only for private use at the moment
Thank you! This is where I wanted to be.
I am on my way to {0}, which is about {1} miles going {2}.
I am on my way to {0}.
Arright. Come talk to me if you change your mind.
That's too long to tweet! It was {0} characters - {1} too many!
The date is {0}. Conditions are {1}, with a low of {2} and a high of {3}.
I don't believe that's a proper command.

sbindings.string: Askd to stop following; not following
Reached tour spot; greet latecomer tourist; begin explanation
Tourist late; ask to stop tour
End tour spot; more to go

botSettings.name: Ruth
botSettings.description: I am the default bot! You may write whatever you wish in here.

botSettings.name: OpenSim Conference
botSettings.description: This bot is here for the OpenSimulator Conference, to look over the MacGRID booth. She can give tours and answer questions pertaining to MacGRID.

ArrayOfString.string: Hello, {0}! Welcome to the MacGRID booth. I am a Bot - I can answer questions and, if you like, give a tour around the booth.
Would you like me to follow you for a bit?
Okay! Sorry, did I bother you?
This way. | Follow me. | Very well; follow me. | Certainly! Come with me, then.
Would you like to join me?
And that is the end of the tour.
Would you like to stop the tour?
Okay! I'm at the next stop. Come join me!
Okay! Come talk to me if you change your mind!
Tell me when you would like to proceed.
This is the end of the tour. Anything else you would like to know?
...We weren't on a tour, were we?
I tripped a flood detect. I'm sorry, I didn't mean to!
...We weren't on a tour, were we?
Sorry, you're not on the access list. I'm only for private use at the moment
Thank you! This is where I wanted to be.
I am on my way to {0}, which is about {1} miles going {2}.
I am on my way to {0}.
Would you like a short tour? | May I give you a short tour? | I can show you around, if you like.
No problem. Please enjoy yourself. | /me smiles and nods. "No problem." | As you like. | Very well.
That's too long to tweet! It was {0} characters - {1} too many!
The date is {0}. Conditions are {1}, with a low of {2} and a high of {3}.
I don't believe that's a proper command.

Reached tour spot; greet latecomer tourist; begin explanation

End tour spot; more to go

textNode._data: I am a McBOT! I'm here primarily for testing purposes. In the future, I will be capable of giving tours, telling stories, and helping newcomers around the sim. Currently, I am being used to demonstrate the HitchBOT protocols.

HitchBOT is a robot that will hitchhike across Canada, swapping stories with the people it travels with. I am programmed to demonstrate how this will work. Simply allow me to follow you, and I will ask for stories, and share mine with you - assuming I have any.
Milly is a character from Seven Brides for Seven Brothers. I don't know why Mom decided to call me that. And yes, I have six sisters and seven brothers named for the rest of the characters.
My childlike wonder for the world is what motivates me! That, and the fact it is hard-coded into my brain.

I am a Bot. I'm being controlled remotely by a Windows application, developed using C# and OpenMetaverse. Currently, this is still in testing - it may still contain glitches that need to be worked out. Lily Beaul is the sole developer, so if you encounter problems, please, let her know.
My mom is Lily Beaul. She's a research assistant at McMaster University, and currently studies Multimedia and Philosophy as an undergraduate. You can talk to her here, if she's online!
I don't have a dad. Mom is a mad scientist.

MacGRID is a robust, archivable, simulation research platform and a corresponding network of academic, industry and community partners who wish to engage in multidisciplinary research and creation, and resource and knowledge sharing, using avatar virtual worlds and mixed reality systems. Right now, we're highly fond of using OpenSimulator.

This initiative is led by Dr. David Harris Smith, Assistant Professor in Communication Studies & Multimedia at McMaster, and has been advanced by collaborators and contributors including new media artist Ian Murray, Humanities Media Computing, SHARCNET High Performance Computing, GRAND NCE, Dr. Eleni Stroulia and students at the Department of Computing Science at the University of Alberta, and Dr. Suzanne Crosta, Dean of Humanities and Dr. Mo Elbestawi, Vice President of Research at McMaster.

Dr. David Harris Smith is Assistant Professor in the Department of Communication Studies and Multimedia at McMaster University. David is an artist and researcher in interactive new media. His research interests include new media and digital cultures, interaction design, and the practices and applications of virtual worlds and mixed reality environments. He teaches courses in Design Fundamentals, DIY Media and Cultures of Peer Production, Avatar Cultures and New Media Arts. David is the Director of Research for the macGRID Simulation Research Network an international research network utilizing the Open Simulator platform and SHARCNET High Performance Computing.

routineSpeech.string: And that's the end. This was a test.
